Description: Lower body sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; cream slip; interior glazed streaky black (much worn); exterior: in handle zone, trace of undetermined pattern; below, band between dilute lines; below on cul, part of lotus flower and bud frieze.
Curator's comments: Lemos identifies this sherd as belonging to the group of vases with floral decoration in the Chalice Style. The lotus flower and lotus bud pattern found on these vessels appears on the exterior surface of the vases and in the later vases the pattern resembles that found on Fikellura vases. However, the same pattern also features on the cul of Wild Goat Style chalices, to which this sherd bears closer similarities. See Lemos no. 114 from Emporio.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 307, no. 1258)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0105) (phase 2)
